Package eHealth

Class UserDB

java.lang.Object
eHealth.DBController
eHealth.UserDB
public class UserDB
extends DBController
This class is used to create the user table, and provide operations for querying the user table.
Author:
marin

    • createUserDBTable

      public void createUserDBTable()

      Creating the user table

      Creates the user table in the database if it does not exist already.

    • insertUserIntoDB

      public java.lang.Boolean insertUserIntoDB​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String date_of_birth, java.lang.String healthInfo, java.lang.String insuranceName, java.lang.String insuranceType, java.lang.String street, int streetNo, java.lang.String zipCode, java.lang.String city)

      Inserting a user into the user table

      A user is inserted into the user table, using the attributes specified by the caller of the method.

      The latitude and longitude is calculated within this method, using OpenStreetMapUtils.

      Parameters:
      username -
      password -
      email -
      firstName -
      lastName -
      date_of_birth -
      healthInfo -
      insuranceName -
      insuranceType -
      street -
      streetNo -
      zipCode -
      city -
      Returns:
      true if user was successfully inserted into the database, else false

    • validLoginData

      public java.lang.Boolean validLoginData​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)

      Validating login data

      Checks if the username and the encrypted password match in the database.
      Parameters:
      username -
      password -
      Returns:
      true if matched, else false

    • updateHealthInfoInDB

      public void updateHealthInfoInDB​(java.lang.String healthInfo, java.lang.String username)

      Updating the health information of a user in the database

      Changes the health information of the given user to the given String.
      Parameters:

      username - User which should have its health information changed
